item.title: NextEra 计划筹资 15 亿美元资助能源项目
item.description: 公用事业公司 NextEra Energy 周一表示，该公司打算通过出售股权单位筹集 15 亿美元，用于资助新项目。【原文：Utility firm NextEra Energy said on Monday it intends to raise $1.5 billion through the sale of equity units to fund new projects.】

item.title: 芯片设计商需求强劲，Cadence上调2024年利润预期中点
item.description: 凯登斯设计系统公司（Cadence Design Systems）周一上调了年度利润预期的中点，押注于生成式人工智能的蓬勃发展将推动对其用于设计为这些系统提供动力的复杂芯片的软件的需求，从而使其股价在延时交易中上涨了 6.4%。【原文：Cadence Design Systems raised the midpoint of its annual profit forecast on Monday, betting on the boom in generative AI to drive demand for its software used to design complex chips that power those systems, sending its shares up 6.4% in extended trading.】

item.title: 美国最终确定遏制对华人工智能投资的规则，并实施其他限制措施
item.description: 拜登政府周一表示，它正在敲定限制美国在中国人工智能和其他可能威胁美国国家安全的技术领域投资的规则。【原文：The Biden administration said on Monday it is finalizing rules that will limit U.S. investments in artificial intelligence and other technology sectors in China that could threaten U.S. national security.】

item.title: Vans 母公司 VF Corp 实现盈利，第二季度销售额超出预期；股价上涨 16
item.description: Vans 母公司 VF Corp 在连续两个季度亏损后扭亏为盈，周一的第二季度销售额超出预期，这得益于其直接面向消费者业务的连续改善和库存的精简，使其股价在收盘后上涨了约 16%。【原文：Vans parent VF Corp turned a profit after two consecutive quarterly losses and beat second-quarter sales estimates on Monday, benefiting from sequential improvement in its direct-to-consumer business and leaner inventory, sending its shares up about 16% after the bell.】

item.title: 西南航空公司必须面对飞行员工会就恐吓和纪律威胁提起的诉讼
item.description: 西南航空公司周一被联邦上诉法院勒令面对其飞行员工会的诉讼，该工会指控该航空公司违反联邦法律，恐吓和惩戒加入该工会的飞行员。【原文：Southwest Airlines was ordered by a federal appeals court on Monday to face a lawsuit by its pilots union, which accused the carrier of violating federal law by intimidating and disciplining pilots for affiliating with it.】

item.title: 汽车制造商福特季度利润超预期，但下调业绩展望
item.description: 福特汽车公司周一公布的第三季度盈利超出华尔街预期，但该公司表示，预计全年息税前盈利将仅达到指导目标的下限。【原文：Ford Motor beat Wall Street's expectations for third-quarter earnings on Monday, but said it expects to meet just the lower end of its full-year guidance for earnings before interest and taxes.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，丰田和 NTT 将投资 33 亿美元研发人工智能自动驾驶汽车
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，丰田汽车和日本电信电话公司将投资 5000 亿日元（约合 32.6 亿美元）用于研发人工智能软件，以改进自动驾驶技术。【原文：Toyota Motor and Japan's Nippon Telegraph and Telephone will be investing 500 billion yen ($3.26 billion) in research and development to create artificial intelligence software to improve self-driving, Nikkei reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通就与病毒式传播故障有关的支票欺诈起诉客户
item.description: 美国最大的银行摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）已开始起诉客户的支票欺诈行为，称他们非法利用在 TikTok 上疯传的临时技术故障不当提取资金。【原文：JPMorgan Chase , the largest U.S. bank, has begun suing customers for check fraud, saying they improperly withdrew funds by taking illegal advantage of a temporary technical glitch that went viral on TikTok.】

item.title: 沃尔玛在节假日前将 Walmart Plus 套餐价格降低一半
item.description: 沃尔玛（Walmart）周一表示，将在节假日来临之前以五折的价格提供会员服务 "Walmart Plus"，该零售商正试图缩小与竞争对手亚马逊（Amazon.com）的 Prime 订阅服务之间的差距。【原文：Walmart said on Monday it would offer its membership service, Walmart Plus, at a 50% discount ahead of the holiday season, as the retailer attempts to close the gap with rival Amazon.com's Prime subscription service.】

item.title: 美国宣布向 SPR 招标 300 万桶石油
item.description: 美国能源部周一宣布了一项新的招标，从 2025 年 4 月到 2025 年 5 月向战略石油储备（SPR）交付多达 300 万桶石油。【原文：The U.S. Department of Energy announced on Monday a new solicitation for up to 3 million barrels of oil for delivery to the strategic petroleum reserve (SPR) from April 2025 through May 2025.】

item.title: OpenAI 主席的人工智能初创公司 Sierra 在最新一轮融资中获得 45 亿美元估值
item.description: 由前 Salesforce 联席首席执行官布雷特-泰勒（Bret Taylor）联合创办的软件初创公司 Sierra 周一表示，该公司在 Greenoaks Capital 领投的新一轮融资中筹集了 1.75 亿美元，估值达 45 亿美元。【原文：Sierra, a software startup co-founded by former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor, has raised $175 million in a new funding round led by Greenoaks Capital that gave it a $4.5 billion valuation, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 世界银行表示，预计主要捐助方将增加国际开发协会的资金认捐额
item.description: 总部设在华盛顿的世界银行高级常务董事阿克塞尔-范特罗森伯格（Axel van Trotsenburg）说，世界银行期待主要捐助方提高对其低收入国家基金的认捐额。【原文：The World Bank is expecting major donors to raise their pledges to its fund for low-income countries, said Axel van Trotsenburg, the Washington-based lender's senior managing director.】

item.title: 墨西哥对美国禁止中国汽车软件和硬件的计划表示担忧
item.description: 出于国家安全考虑，拜登政府提议禁止中国的关键软件和硬件在美国道路上的联网汽车中使用，墨西哥政府周一对此表示担忧。【原文：The Mexican government on Monday raised concerns about the Biden administration's proposal to prohibit key Chinese software and hardware in connected vehicles on American roads due to national security concerns.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 和达美航空因航班中断相互起诉
item.description: 网络安全公司 CrowdStrike 周一表示，在 7 月份一次错误的软件更新导致全球网络中断后，该公司在美国佐治亚州地区法院起诉达美航空公司。【原文：Cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike said on Monday it sued Delta Air Lines in U.S. District Court in Georgia after a faulty software update prompted a global outage in July.】

item.title: 诉讼称赛百味三明治缺肉
item.description: 一项新的诉讼指控 Subway "严重误导 "顾客，宣传三明治中的肉类含量至少是其提供的含量的三倍。【原文：A new lawsuit accuses Subway of "grossly misleading" customers by advertising sandwiches that contain at least three times as much meat as it delivers.】

item.title: 保时捷员工将加入德国重要行业的罢工浪潮
item.description: IG Metall 工会地方分会表示，德国斯图加特保时捷汽车制造厂的员工将于周二加入德国主要行业的罢工浪潮，这是为推动提高薪酬而计划采取的全国性行动的一部分。【原文：Porsche AG staff at the German carmaker's site in Stuttgart will join a wave of strikes in key German industries on Tuesday, said IG Metall union's local branch, as part of national action planned to push for higher pay.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，雅诗兰黛任命内部人士 Stéphane de La Faverie 为新任首席执行官
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一援引知情人士的话报道，化妆品巨头雅诗兰黛（Estee Lauder）已选择长期担任高级管理人员的斯特凡-德拉-法维里（Stéphane de La Faverie）接任首席执行官一职。【原文：Cosmetics giant Estee Lauder has picked longtime senior executive Stéphane de La Faverie to take over as its chief executive officer, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体在白宫竞选最后阶段激增 20
item.description: 美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司股价周一飙升至 6 月份以来的最高点，延续了近期的涨势，因为在竞选白宫连任的最后阶段，博彩赔率看好这位共和党候选人。【原文：Shares of former U.S. President Donald Trump's media company surged to their highest since June on Monday, extending a recent rally as betting odds favored the Republican candidate in the final stretch of his bid for reelection to the White House.】

item.title: 财政部可能在美国大选前保留债务计划
item.description: 财政部可能会在本周公布其最新的退税计划时，就其 2025 年债务拍卖的预期增长提供新的指导，尽管 11 月 5 日美国大选的不确定性可能意味着任何细节都将微乎其微。【原文：The Treasury Department may offer fresh guidance on expected increases in its 2025 debt auctions when it announces its updated refunding plans this week, though uncertainty over the Nov. 5 U.S. elections likely means any details will be minimal.】

item.title: 美国银行任命内部人士布莱恩-温斯坦（Brian Weinstein）领导其欧洲、中东和非洲地区全球市场部门
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份备忘录，美国银行已任命拥有 30 年从业经验的布莱恩-温斯坦（Brian Weinstein）担任新设立的欧洲、中东和非洲地区全球市场部主管一职。【原文：Bank of America has appointed 30-year veteran Brian Weinstein to a newly created role as head of its EMEA Global Markets division, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官称 "是时候反击监管 "了
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）在周一的一次会议上抨击了有关资本规则、银行卡支付和开放银行业务的几项主要监管举措。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon blasted several major regulatory initiatives on capital rules, card payments and open banking at a conference on Monday.】

item.title: Meta 开发自己的人工智能搜索引擎，以减少对谷歌和必应的依赖，The Information 报道
item.description: 据 Information 周一报道，Meta Platforms 公司正在开发一款基于人工智能的搜索引擎，以减少对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌和微软必应的依赖。【原文：Meta Platforms is working on an artificial intelligence-based search engine as it looks to reduce dependence on Alphabet's Google and Microsoft's Bing, the Information reported on Monday.】

item.title: 初创公司 Untether 推出人工智能芯片
item.description: 初创公司 Untether 周一发布了一款人工智能芯片，旨在为汽车、农业设备和其他边缘应用场景中的人工智能应用提供支持。【原文：Startup Untether launched an artificial intelligence chip on Monday that aims to power AI applications in cars, agricultural devices and other edge-case scenarios, the company said.】

item.title: 卡塔尔能源公司获得伊拉克道达尔能源公司太阳能项目 50% 的股份
item.description: 卡塔尔能源公司（QatarEnergy）是世界上最大的液化天然气供应商之一，该公司周一表示，已同意持有道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）在伊拉克的 1.25 千兆瓦太阳能项目 50%的股份。【原文：QatarEnergy, one of the world's top suppliers of liquefied natural gas, said on Monday it had agreed to take a 50% stake in TotalEnergies' 1.25-gigawatt solar project in Iraq.】

item.title: 德国银行集团负责人表示，欧洲银行业联盟对推动合并至关重要
item.description: 德国银行协会负责人表示，欧洲银行业联盟的进展对于政策制定者推动鼓励跨国兼并至关重要，因为只有在银行服务有共同市场的情况下，银行才能发挥协同效应。【原文：Progress on European banking union is vital to policymakers' push to encourage cross-border mergers because banks will only be able to leverage synergies if there is a common market for their services, the head of Germany's banks' association said.】

item.title: 花旗集团在冲突中将部分员工调离黎巴嫩
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周一告诉路透社，随着以色列与真主党之间冲突的升级，美国花旗集团已将 "极少数 "员工从黎巴嫩转移到土耳其。【原文：U.S. bank Citigroup has moved a "very small" number of its employees from Lebanon into Turkey as the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah escalates, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 美国电话电报公司宣布与康宁公司达成价值 10 亿美元的光纤交易
item.description: AT&T 公司周一表示，它已与康宁公司达成一项价值 10 亿美元的多年期协议，购买光纤、电缆和连接解决方案，因为这家美国电信巨头希望扩大其高速互联网服务。【原文：AT&T said on Monday it had struck a $1 billion multi-year deal with Corning to buy fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions, as the U.S. telecom giant looks to expand its high-speed internet services.】

item.title: 诺华公司将向 Monte Rosa 公司支付 1.5 亿美元的预付款，用于开发一类新药
item.description: 瑞士制药巨头诺华公司周一表示，将向 Monte Rosa Therapeutics 公司支付 1.5 亿美元的预付款，以获得开发、生产和销售某些候选药物的全球许可。【原文：Swiss pharmaceutical giant Novartis will pay Monte Rosa Therapeutics $150 million upfront payment for a global license to develop, manufacture and sell some drug candidates, the U.S.-based biotech firm said on Monday.】

item.title: 对大众汽车劳工主管警告将在德国大规模裁员和关闭工厂的反应
item.description: 大众汽车公司劳资协议会负责人周一表示，大众汽车计划关闭在德国的至少三家工厂，裁员数万人，并收缩其在欧洲最大经济体的其余工厂，因为该公司计划进行比预期更深入的改革。【原文：Volkswagen plans to shut at least three factories in Germany, lay off tens of thousands of staff and shrink its remaining plants in Europe's biggest economy as it plots a deeper-than-expected overhaul, the carmaker's works council head said on Monday.】

item.title: 在佛罗里达州开展业务的美国地区银行为飓风影响做好准备
item.description: 一些地区性贷款机构在第三季度拨付了贷款损失准备金，以应对近期飓风（主要是佛罗里达州的飓风）可能造成的借款人违约，这凸显了极端天气和气候变化给银行带来的风险。【原文：Several regional lenders allocated loan-loss provisions in the third quarter to cover potential defaults by borrowers grappling with recent hurricanes, primarily in Florida, highlighting the risks extreme weather and climate change pose to banks.】
